alert.note: Alert for North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 05 at 11:08AM PST until January 07 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THURSDAY TO 7 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Tidal overflow flooding expected along low lying sections of the coast. Total tide near 11 ft on Thursday afternoon, and 10.5 ft on Friday morning. Will see a period of minor flooding during low the very low tide late Thursday. * WHERE...North Oregon Coast. * WHEN...From 1 PM Thursday to 7 AM PST Friday. High tides will occur around 330 PM Thursday and again around 5 AM Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding, up to one foot above ground level, during the high tides is expected in the low lying areas near bays, sloughs, and the lower reaches of the coastal rivers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of high running rivers and increased total tides may create localized areas of flooding, especially along low lying areas of the coast. The total high tide in Astoria is forecast at 11.0 ft at 330 PM Thursday and again around 5 AM Friday.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory means that tidal overflow flooding is expected. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and property. A Coastal Flood Advisory for Minor Tidal Overflow indicates that coastal and inland flooding of low lying areas is expected due to elevated river levels combined with high astronomical tides. Property damage can occur, but is usually localized. Low-lying roads may be closed due to high water.
